Uses of Package
geometry.planar

  • Packages that use geometry.planar 
    Package Description
    autoroute
    Contains functionality of the autoroute algorithm.
    board
    Contains classes describing items on a printed circuit board and the board itself.
    boardgraphics
    Contains user interface independent functionality for displaying a board on a sccreen.
    datastructures
    Contains general purpose datastructures.
    designformats.specctra
    Contains classes for reading and writing board designs in the Specctra dsn text format.
    geometry.planar
    Contains general purpose 2-dimensional geometry classes.
    gui
    Contains functionality of the graphical user interface based on javax.swing.
    interactive
    Contains functionality for interactive board handling, which is independent of the graphical user interface.
    library
    Describes library objects of a printed circuit board such as padstacks and component packages.
    tests
    Contains functions for testing and checking the consistancy of the board database.
  • Classes in geometry.planar used by autoroute 
    Class and Description
    FloatLine
    Defines a line in the plane by to FloatPoints.
    FloatPoint
    Implements a point in the plane as a touple of double's.
    IntBox
    Implements functionality of orthogonal rectangles in the plane with integer coordinates.
    IntPoint
    Implementation of the abstract class Point as a tuple of integers.
    Point
    Abstract class describing functionality for Points in the plane.
    TileShape
    Abstract class defining functionality for convex shapes, whose borders consists of straight lines.
  • Classes in geometry.planar used by board 
    Class and Description
    Area
    An Area is a not necessarily simply connected Shape, which means, that it may contain holes.
    Circle
    Discribes functionality of a circle shape in the plane.
    ConvexShape
    A shape is defined as convex, if for each line segment with both endpoints contained in the shape the whole segment is contained completely in the shape.
    Direction
    Abstract class defining functionality of directions in the plane.
    FloatPoint
    Implements a point in the plane as a touple of double's.
    IntBox
    Implements functionality of orthogonal rectangles in the plane with integer coordinates.
    IntOctagon
    Implements functionality for convex shapes, whose borderline directions are multiples of 45 degree and defined with integer coordinates.
    IntPoint
    Implementation of the abstract class Point as a tuple of integers.
    Line
    Implements functionality for lines in the plane.
    LineSegment
    Implements functionality for line segments.
    Point
    Abstract class describing functionality for Points in the plane.
    Polyline
    A Polyline is a sequence of lines, where no 2 consecutive lines may be parallel.
    PolylineShape
    Abstract class with functions for shapes, whose borders consist ob straight lines.
    Shape
    Interface describing functionality for connected 2-dimensional shapes in the plane.
    TileShape
    Abstract class defining functionality for convex shapes, whose borders consists of straight lines.
    Vector
    Abstract class describing functionality of Vectors.
  • Classes in geometry.planar used by boardgraphics 
    Class and Description
    Area
    An Area is a not necessarily simply connected Shape, which means, that it may contain holes.
    Circle
    Discribes functionality of a circle shape in the plane.
    Ellipse
    Describes functionality of an elllipse in the plane.
    FloatPoint
    Implements a point in the plane as a touple of double's.
    IntBox
    Implements functionality of orthogonal rectangles in the plane with integer coordinates.
    Shape
    Interface describing functionality for connected 2-dimensional shapes in the plane.
  • Classes in geometry.planar used by datastructures 
    Class and Description
    Point
    Abstract class describing functionality for Points in the plane.
    RegularTileShape
    TileShapes whose border lines may have only directions out of a fixed set, as for example orthoganal directions, which define axis parallel box shapes.
    ShapeBoundingDirections
    Describing the functionality for the fixed directions of a RegularTileShape.
    TileShape
    Abstract class defining functionality for convex shapes, whose borders consists of straight lines.
  • Classes in geometry.planar used by designformats.specctra 
    Class and Description
    Line
    Implements functionality for lines in the plane.
    Shape
    Interface describing functionality for connected 2-dimensional shapes in the plane.
    Vector
    Abstract class describing functionality of Vectors.
  • Classes in geometry.planar used by geometry.planar 
    Class and Description
    Area
    An Area is a not necessarily simply connected Shape, which means, that it may contain holes.
    Circle
    Discribes functionality of a circle shape in the plane.
    ConvexShape
    A shape is defined as convex, if for each line segment with both endpoints contained in the shape the whole segment is contained completely in the shape.
    Direction
    Abstract class defining functionality of directions in the plane.
    FloatLine
    Defines a line in the plane by to FloatPoints.
    FloatPoint
    Implements a point in the plane as a touple of double's.
    FortyfiveDegreeBoundingDirections
    Implements the abstract class ShapeBoundingDirections as the 8 directions, which are multiples of 45 degree.
    FortyfiveDegreeDirection 
    IntBox
    Implements functionality of orthogonal rectangles in the plane with integer coordinates.
    IntDirection
    Implements an abstract class Direction as an equivalence class of IntVector's.
    IntOctagon
    Implements functionality for convex shapes, whose borderline directions are multiples of 45 degree and defined with integer coordinates.
    IntPoint
    Implementation of the abstract class Point as a tuple of integers.
    IntVector
    Implementation of the interface Vector via a tuple of integers
    Line
    Implements functionality for lines in the plane.
    LineSegment
    Implements functionality for line segments.
    OrthogonalBoundingDirections
    Implements the abstract class ShapeDirections as the 4 orthogonal directions.
    Point
    Abstract class describing functionality for Points in the plane.
    Polygon
    A Polygon is a list of points in the plane, where no 2 consecutive points may be equal and no 3 consecutive points collinear.
    PolygonShape
    Shape described bei a closed polygon of corner points.
    Polyline
    A Polyline is a sequence of lines, where no 2 consecutive lines may be parallel.
    PolylineArea
    A PolylineArea is an Area, where the outside border curve and the hole borders consist of straight lines.
    PolylineShape
    Abstract class with functions for shapes, whose borders consist ob straight lines.
    RegularTileShape
    TileShapes whose border lines may have only directions out of a fixed set, as for example orthoganal directions, which define axis parallel box shapes.
    Shape
    Interface describing functionality for connected 2-dimensional shapes in the plane.
    ShapeBoundingDirections
    Describing the functionality for the fixed directions of a RegularTileShape.
    Side
    Implementation of an enum class Side with the three values ON_THE_LEFT, ON_THE_RIGHT, COLLINEAR.
    Simplex
    Convex shape defined as intersection of half-planes.
    TileShape
    Abstract class defining functionality for convex shapes, whose borders consists of straight lines.
    Vector
    Abstract class describing functionality of Vectors.
